medium: Animal hide, sinew, cotton, glass beads
title: Moccasins
text: Pikuni moccasin construction and beadwork techniques are similar to those of their tribal neighbors, the A'ani (Gros Ventre) and the Nehiiyawak (Plains Cree). All three tribes use the chevron design on the vamps of their moccasins, and often use the spot stitch technique.
creditline: The Christina N. and Swan J. Turnblad Memorial Fund
